question.body: Which of the following molecules would be easiest to extract from a membrane using aqueous solutions?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Integral proteins span throughout the entire membrane and would not be easy to extract.
Correct. Peripheral proteins are found on the outside of the membrane, not within it, and would be the easiest to extract.
Incorrect. Remember phospholipids are the main component of the cell membrane and would not be easy to extract.
Incorrect. Remember cholesterol is embedded within the phospholipid tails in the middle of the membrane.
